body:
## What's Changed
* Fix #451: Improve README by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/454
* Upgrade server version for testing by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/458
* Change the default of connection database name from username to empty string by @blackeyepanda in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/459
* Fix #457: handle decode error for error/notice message by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/460

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.1.0...1.1.1

## What's Changed
* Return INTERVAL data as dateutil.relativedelta object by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/446
* Return TIMETZ data as datetime.time object by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/447
* Fix #398: Binary format data transfer by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/452
* Add the option to bypass data conversion to Python objects by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/450
* Remove pypi classifiers by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/445


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.0.5...1.1.0

## What's Changed
* Fix #397: Use socketfile to improve read performance by @alonme in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/441
* Update test python versions by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/443

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.0.4...1.0.5

## What's Changed
* Restore DNS Round Robin Behavior by @DMickens in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/430
* Fix #434 add type hints to public functions by @jannisko in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/436
* Fix #438 executemany() insert double qoute data by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/439
* Update README and Upgrade test framework by @sitingren


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.0.3...1.0.4

## What's Changed
* Refine README by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/427
* Update copyright year to 2022 by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/428
* Limit max send message size to 8192 bytes by @sitingren in https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/pull/431


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.0.2...1.0.3

## What's Changed
* New behavior: Parsing text representation of [var]binary data sent by server in #414
* Support leading whitespace for inserts in executemany (#415) by @vhermecz in #416
* Fix #419: Improve error handling for COPY LOCAL queries in #420
* Improve Connection.cancel() readme description and tests in #418
* Infrastructure update:  Migrate test from Travis CI to Github Actions in #405, #406, #407
* Infrastructure update:  Update copyright year to 2021 in #404

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/vertica/vertica-python/compare/1.0.1...1.0.2

* Raise ConnectionError in connection.write (#401)
* Fix `DATETIME` type object: add the missing vertica type DATE (#402)
* Add tests for `Cursor.description` (#402)
* Upgrade Travis test settings and update README (#400) (#402)
* Fixed #387: Add Autocommit APIs (#395)

* Support COPY FROM LOCAL (#386)
* Add numeric prefix schema support for cursor.executemany() (#382)
* Fix rowcount inconsistency for nextset (#388)

* Improve Cursor.copy() error handling (#367)
* Add default tuple adapter (#368)(#372)
* Make vertica_python.errors classes (un)picklable (#374)

* fetchone() performance improvements (#356)(#361)
* query with parameters improvements (#363)

- Fixed #352: Bug when log_path set to None (#354) 
- Fixed #330: Remove future dependency (#351)
- Update copyright for 2020

- New feature: Allow logging without file handler (#341)
- New feature: UUID type column data returned as `uuid.UUID` object (#349)
- Fixed #345: Copy from file like object (#346)
- Fixed #257: error in SSL check_hostname option (#347) 
- Fixed quoting issue with client-side %s parameters (#344)
- Infrastructure update: Suppress pytest DeprecationWarnings (#343)

* New feature: Kerberos authentication support (#327) 
* New feature: `Connection.cancel()` support, deprecate `Cursor.cancel()` (#331) 
* Improvement: #325 Cursor.copy: support temporary files (#326) 
* Improvement: #312 Improve access to notice/error content via properties (#328) 
* Infrastructure update: Change from nose test to pytest (#329)

* New feature #195: Connect using connection string (#311)
* Improvement: Replace `pytz` with `python-dateutil` (#323) 
* Improvement: Add IPv6 host support (#320) 
* Improvement #312: Friendly notice/error messages (#318) 
* Fixed #314: Add explanation to errors generated by raise_from (#317)
* Infrastructure update: Add Python3.8 tests (#319)

* Fixed #296: fix Startup message's client_os_user_name (#305)
* Implemented client backward compatibility (protocol 3.7) (#305)
* Fixed #299: update the transaction status when closing the connection (#300)
* Updated README.md for connection_timeout (#302)

* Fixed #296 partially: fix default connection 'user' behavior (#297)
* Forced log file to UTF-8 encoding,  as the system default encoding may be incompatible with some Unicode characters. (#295)

* Fixed #281: fix regex for cursor.executemany() (#282)
* Fixed #292: add awareness of autocommit to cursor.executemany()(#293)
* Added support of inserting bytes and UUID objects when use_prepared_statements=False (#289)
* Added python 3.7 test to Travis-CI (#284)
* Removed dated read_timeout option from README (#283)

* Removed psycopg2 dependency (i.e. removed `pip install 'vertica-python[namedparams]'`) (#276)
* Fixed #272: Make THROW_ERROR function throws an error (#277)
* Improved cursor close logic (#274)

* Fixed #147: Added SHA512 authentication support (#266)
* Fixed #180: Added password expiration logic (#268)
* Added authentication tests (#270)

* New Feature: server-side prepared statements
* Support UDtypes (GEOMETRY & GEOGRAPHY)
* Update README
* Add more debug logging
* Fix DBAPI type object for python 3
Fix #251: Write notice messages to log

* Upgrade supported Vertica protocol to 3.4
* Add session_label connection setting (#241)
* Fix #185 (#242)
* Add more info to cursor.description (#244)
* Add LostConnectivityFailure error (#245)

* Added Vertica Connection Load balancing and Failover features
* Added logging feature
* Improved test framework
* Travis CI Setup
* Several fixes: #209 #175 #233 #179 #213 #181

First release after Vertica took ownership of this repo.
1. Updated README
1. Added Contributing guidelines
1. Updated license and copyright in files
fixes for executemany
Fix handling of None params

Fix nextset() handling of errors
Add cancel() to connection and cursor

Adds executemany for pandas compatibility
Better string compatibility for python 2/3
Fix regression in support for 2.6
Various code cleanup and refactoring
Fixing empty query input case
More unicode fixes

Fixes simple string named param case for python3
Enable keepalive
Doc fix
Fixes md5 auth in python3
Fixes issue with python 3 support for decimal type
two python3 fixes
fixes ssl bug in python3
fixes setup.py dependency issue in 0.6.0
python3 support
SSL support
Add flag to specify unicode error handling.
Handle unknown data types
Add support for timestamp with year > 9999 (truncate years)
Includes improved copy method originally written by @johano99 and modified for merging by @lemeryfertitta
Edit connection params to use kwargs instead of dict to be more dbapi compliant
Removes row_handler callback in favor of an iterator.
windows crypt support
When vertica gives back data types that aren't mapped in the `vertica/column.py` file, execution of query fails. This prevent it by defaulting the data type to **unspecified**.
Incorporating @kennethdamica PR to accept execute parameters as a tuple or dict

Incorporates build changes/fixes contributed by @kevints.
No functional changes to the library.
